page.title: 15The feeling in Adisham area
page.content: There is universal acknowledgement of the friendliness of Adisham and all agreed they liked living there. The peacefulness and countryside are much appreciated. There appears to be no class distinctions, political issues or deep local problems. Some older people have lived there all their lives and many feel that the village is losing or has lost its identity with the influx of new people. They think the caring attitude has declined. Newcomers are regarded as less friendly and wanting to change things. In spite of this, there seems to be a great spirit of helpfulness among the inhabitants and houses are exchanged in order to remain. The Parish Council negotiates, apparently amicably, with local farmers on problems arising between the village and farmers on such things as footpath alterations etc.
